Package states

Class Overworld

java.lang.Object
states.State
states.Overworld
All Implemented Interfaces:
StateMethods
public class Overworld extends State implements StateMethods
This is a child class of State that implements the StateMethods interface. This represents the overworld of the game. This screen will allow the player to move a specific level and show the user's current progress in the game.
Author:
John Botonakis and Sean-Paul Brown

  • Field Details

    • background

      private final BufferedImage background
      The image that will be dispalyed in the background of the overworld menu

    • btnLocations

      private final Point[] btnLocations
      The array of button locations that will be displayed on screen, it is the same array as the Constants.OverworldButtonConstants.BUTTON_POINT_ARRAY.

    • menu

      private final MenuButton menu
      This will be a button that will link back to the Instructions

    • buttonArr

      private OverworldButton[] buttonArr
      The array of OverworldButtons that will be displayed on screen that match to the locations array

    • selectedLvl

      private OverworldButton selectedLvl
      The level that was selected by the user

    • lvlNames

      private String[] lvlNames
      All of the level names correlate to the buttonArr

    • levelManager

      private final LevelManager levelManager
      This should be the same LevelManager as the Game's Playing class. This allows it to influence the current levels and what will be loaded next.

    • owFont

      private Font owFont
      The font to use in the overworld.

  • Constructor Details

    • Overworld

      public Overworld(Game game)
      This is the constructor for a Overworld menu. This can only be called after the Game has a Playing class created
      Parameters:
      game - - the Game handling this menu

  • Method Details

    • initButtons

      private void initButtons()
      This is where we load each of buttons. It uses a for loop that runs for the length of buttonArr.length to generate new buttons at the locations of matching indexes in btnLocations

    • update

      public void update()
      This update will make sure that the page can respond to the user's inputs and other events on screen
      Specified by:
      update in interface StateMethods

    • updateLevelBooleans

      private void updateLevelBooleans()
      This method will update all of the booleans for each Overworld button for the Level that represents them in LevelMaanger

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics g)
      This method will draw the overworld to the Graphics g inputted into the function. It utilizes the OverworldButton's draw function.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics where to draw the Overworld

    • mouseDragged

      public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e)
      This is called when the mouse is pressed and moved; ignored in this class
      Specified by:
      mouseDragged in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - what the mouse is doing

    • mousePressed

      public void mousePressed(MouseEvent e)
      This deals with that happens when the mouse is pressed down. It checks if the mouse is over any button, and if so then sets the mousePressed of that button to true.
      Specified by:
      mousePressed in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - what the mouse is doing

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e)
      THIS FUNCTION IS UNUSED
      Specified by:
      mouseClicked in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - what the mouse is doing

    • mouseReleased

      public void mouseReleased(MouseEvent e)
      When the mouse is released, this method should be called. It checks if the mouse in on a button and it is was pressed on that button.
      Specified by:
      mouseReleased in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - what the mouse is doing

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e)
      When the mouse is moved (pressed or not), this method should be called. It checks where the mouse is and sets the Button's mouseOver boolean (if appropriate)
      Specified by:
      mouseMoved in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - what the mouse is doing

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      This handles what happens when a key is pressed.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - information about the key that was pressed

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      This handles what happens when a key is released; Ignored in this class
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface StateMethods
      Parameters:
      e - - information about the key that was pressed

    • isInOB

      private boolean isInOB(MouseEvent e, OverworldButton ob)
      This function will determine if the cursor of the mouse is inside the bounds of a button.
      Parameters:
      e - - the mouseEvent
      ob - - the OverworldButton to look at
      Returns:
      true if the MouseEvent's x and y are within the buttons bounds

    • applyState

      private void applyState(OverworldButton ob)
      If the level is not hidden, then set the next level and apply the GameState PLAYING
      Parameters:
      ob - - the OverworldButton that was selected (it's stage number will be the level to be loaded)

    • drawString

      private void drawString(Graphics g, String text, int x, int y)
      Draw string is a formatter for the displayed level names in the Overworld, such that symbols like \n are recognized when drawn to the screen
      Parameters:
      g - - Graphics object to draw to screen
      text - - The text to be formatted and passed in
      x - - The intended X-Position
      y - - The intended Y-Position
